str2: Salt. From hals; salt; figuratively, prudence.
Properly, beautiful, but chiefly good, i.e. Valuable or virtuous.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.
Salt. From hals; salt; figuratively, prudence.
Saltless, tasteless, flat. Saltless, i.e. Insipid.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Dative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: Prop: I arrange, make ready; I season, flavor. From a presumed derivative of airo; to prepare, i.e. Spice.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Neuter 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Salt. From hals; salt; figuratively, prudence.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

str2: To be peaceful, keep the peace, be at peace. From eirene; to be peaceful.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Reciprocal Pronoun - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: One another, each other. Genitive plural from allos reduplicated; one another.
